    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        initialize the internal objects. This method has to be called directly in the constructors.

      • loadStyles

        loads the font

      • getGridLabelRenderer

        public GridLabelRenderer getGridLabelRenderer()
        Returns:
        the renderer for the grid and labels

      • addSeries

        public void addSeries(Series s)
        Add a new series to the graph. This will automatically redraw the graph.
        Parameters:
        s - the series to be added

      • getSeries

        public java.util.List<Series> getSeries()
        important: do not do modifications on the list object that will be returned. Use removeSeries(com.jjoe64.graphview.series.Series) and addSeries(com.jjoe64.graphview.series.Series)
        Returns:
        all series

      • onDataChanged

        public void onDataChanged(boolean keepLabelsSize,
                          boolean keepViewport)
        call this to let the graph redraw and recalculate the viewport. This will be called when a new series was added or removed and when data was appended via BaseSeries.appendData(com.jjoe64.graphview.series.DataPointInterface, boolean, int) or BaseSeries.resetData(com.jjoe64.graphview.series.DataPointInterface[]).
        Parameters:
        keepLabelsSize - true if you don't want to recalculate the size of the labels. It is recommended to use "true" because this will improve performance and prevent a flickering.
        keepViewport - true if you don't want that the viewport will be recalculated. It is recommended to use "true" for performance.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
        will be called from Android system.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas

      • drawTitle

        protected void drawTitle(Canvas canvas)
        Draws the Graphs title that will be shown above the viewport. Will be called by GraphView.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas

      • getTitleHeight

        protected int getTitleHeight()
        Calculates the height of the title.
        Returns:
        the actual size of the title. if there is no title, 0 will be returned.

      • getViewport

        public Viewport getViewport()
        Returns:
        the viewport of the Graph.
        See Also:
        Viewport

      • onSizeChanged

        protected void onSizeChanged(int w,
                             int h,
                             int oldw,
                             int oldh)
        Called by Android system if the size of the view was changed. Will recalculate the viewport and labels.
        Parameters:
        w -
        h -
        oldw -
        oldh -

      • getGraphContentLeft

        public int getGraphContentLeft()
        Returns:
        the space on the left side of the view from the left border to the beginning of the graph viewport.

      • getGraphContentTop

        Returns:
        the space on the top of the view from the top border to the beginning of the graph viewport.

        public void removeAllSeries()
        Removes all series of the graph.

      • removeSeries

        public void removeSeries(Series<?> series)
        Remove a specific series of the graph. This will also re-render the graph, but without recalculating the viewport and label sizes. If you want this, you have to call onDataChanged(boolean, boolean) manually.
        Parameters:
        series -
